sn22.47:2.1: Read avigataṁ (“not rid”) here and SN 22.89:5.9; cf. AN 6.13:6.2, DN 33:2.2.106, DN 34:1.7.63.
sn22.47:2.2: From here the discourse alludes to dependent origination. The sense faculties are “conceived”, i.e. “take rebirth”, like name and form (SN 12.39:1.4) or consciousness (SN 12.59:1.2) or an embryo (MN 93:18.61).
sn22.47:2.4: The “mind” (mano) in the presence of “ignorance” makes choices that drive the cycle (SN 12.25:10.3). Here mano, as usual, signifies the active volitional dimension of mind, while ignorance is shown to be not self-existent, but part of the complex of mental activity.
sn22.47:2.5: Through “contact” and “feeling” there arises the “grasping” of views of self.
sn22.47:2.6: See Uddālaka’s, “I am that, I indeed am that” (iyam aham asmīyam aham asmīti, Chāndogya Upaniṣad 6.10.1) and “I am” (ahamasmi) at Sāman Veda 594.
sn22.47:3.1: This is the one who ends the cycle.
